revision.text:
{{short description|Wikipedia list article}} [[File:Nobel Prize.png|150px|thumb|The Nobel Prize]] This is a list of Nobel laureates who are [[Poles]]. The [[Nobel Prize]] is a set of annual international awards bestowed on "those who conferred the greatest benefit on humankind", first instituted in 1901. Since 1903, there have been eighteen Poles who were awarded nineteen Nobel Prizes. Poles have been the recipients in all award categories: [[Nobel Prize in Physics|Physics]], [[Nobel Prize in Chemistry|Chemistry]], [[Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine|Physiology or Medicine]], [[Nobel Prize in Literature|Literature]], [[Nobel Peace Prize|Peace]] and [[Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences|Economics]]. ==Laureates== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! Year !! colspan=2|Winner !! Field !! Contribution |- | 1903 | [[File:Marie Curie c1920.jpg|75px]] | [[Maria Skłodowska Curie]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1903/marie-curie/biographical/|title=Marie Curie: The Nobel Prize in Physics 1903|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Physics | "for their joint researches on the radiation phenomena discovered by Professor [[Henri Becquerel]]" |- | 1905 | [[File:Henryk Sienkiewicz 1905.jpg|75px]] | [[Henryk Sienkiewicz]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/literature/1905/sienkiewicz/biographical/|title=Henryk Sienkiewicz: The Nobel Prize in Literature 1905|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Literature | "because of his outstanding merits as an epic writer" |- | 1907 | [[File:Albert Abraham Michelson2.jpg|75px]] | [[Albert A. Michelson]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1907/michelson/biographical/|title=Albert A. Michelson: The Nobel Prize in Physics 1907|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Physics | "for his optical precision instruments and the spectroscopic and metrological investigations carried out with their aid" |- | 1911 | [[File:Marie Curie c1920.jpg|75px]] | [[Maria Skłodowska Curie]] (2nd time){{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/1911/summary/|title=Marie Curie: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry 1911|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Chemistry | "for the discovery of the elements [[radium]] and [[polonium]], by the isolation of radium and the study of the nature and compounds of this remarkable element" |- | 1924 | [[File:Wladyslaw Reymont 1924.jpg|75px]] | [[Władysław Reymont]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/literature/1924/reymont/biographical/|title=Wladyslaw Reymont: The Nobel Prize in Literature 1924|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Literature | "for his great national epic, [[The Peasants]]" |- | 1944 | [[File:II Rabi.jpg|75px]] | [[Isidor Isaac Rabi]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1944/rabi/biographical/|title=Isidor Isaac Rabi: The Nobel Prize in Physics 1944|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Physics | "for his resonance method for recording the magnetic properties of atomic nuclei" |- | 1950 | [[File:Thadeus Reichstein ETH-Bib Portr 10137.jpg|75px]] | [[Tadeusz Reichstein]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/medicine/1950/reichstein/biographical/|title=Tadeus Reichstein: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 1950|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Medicine | "for their discoveries relating to the hormones of the adrenal cortex, their structure and biological effects" |- | 1977 | [[File:Andrew Schally portrait.jpg|75px]] | [[Andrew Schally|Andrzej Schally]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/medicine/1977/schally/facts/|title=Andrew V. Schally: The Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine 1977|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Medicine | "for their discoveries concerning the peptide hormone production of the brain" |- | rowspan=2|1978 | [[File:Menachem Begin, Andrews AFB, 1978.JPG|75px]] | [[Menachem Begin]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/peace/1978/begin/facts/|title=Menachem Begin: The Nobel Peace Prize 1978|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Peace | "for the Camp David Agreement, which brought about a negotiated peace between Egypt and Israel" |- | [[File:Isaac Bashevis Singer (upright).jpg|75px]] | [[Isaac Bashevis Singer]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/literature/1978/summary/|title=Isaac Bashevis Singer: The Nobel Prize in Literature 1978|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Literature | "for his impassioned narrative art which, with roots in a Polish-Jewish cultural tradition, brings universal human conditions to life" |- | 1980 | [[File:Czeslaw Milosz 3 ap.tif|75px]] | [[Czesław Miłosz]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/literature/1980/summary/|title=Czeslaw Milosz: The Nobel Prize in Literature 1980|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Literature | "who with uncompromising clear-sightedness voices man's exposed condition in a world of severe conflicts" |- | 1981 | [[File:Roald Hoffmann.jpg|75px]] | [[Roald Hoffmann]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/1981/hoffmann/biographical/|title=Roald Hoffmann: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry 1981|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Chemistry | "for their theories, developed independently, concerning the course of chemical reactions" |- | 1983 | [[File:Lech Walesa OAF Visit.jpg|75px]] | [[Lech Wałęsa]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/peace/1983/walesa/facts/|title=Lech Walesa: The Nobel Peace Prize 1983|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Peace | "Founder of [[Solidarność]]; campaigner for human rights" |- | 1992 | [[File:CHARPAK Georges-24x50-2005 cropped.JPG|75px]] | [[Georges Charpak|Jerzy Charpak]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1992/charpak/facts/|title=Georges Charpak: The Nobel Prize in Physics 1992|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Physics | "for his invention and development of particle detectors, in particular the multiwire proportional chamber" |- | 1994 | [[File:Shimon Peres by David Shankbone.jpg|75px]] | [[Shimon Peres]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/peace/1994/peres/facts/|title=Shimon Peres: The Nobel Peace Prize 1994|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-10-10}} | Peace | "to honour a political act which called for great courage on both sides, and which has opened up opportunities for a new development towards fraternity in the Middle East." |- | 1995 | [[File:Josef Rotblat ID badge.png|75px]] | [[Józef Rotblat]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/peace/1995/rotblat/facts/|title=Joseph Rotblat: The Nobel Peace Prize 1995|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Peace | "for their efforts to diminish the part played by nuclear arms in international politics and, in the longer run, to eliminate such arms" |- | 1996 | [[File:Wisława Szymborska 2009.10.23 (1).jpg|75px]] | [[Wisława Szymborska]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/literature/1996/summary/|title=Wislawa Szymborska: The Nobel Prize in Literature 1996|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Literature | "for poetry that with ironic precision allows the historical and biological context to come to light in fragments of human reality" |- | 2007 | [[File:Leonid Hurwicz (square).jpg|75px]] | [[Leonid Hurwicz]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/economic-sciences/2007/hurwicz/biographical/|title=Leonid Hurwicz: The Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel 2007|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Economics | "for having laid the foundations of mechanism design theory" |- | 2018 | [[File:Olga Tokarczuk (2018).jpg|75px]] | [[Olga Tokarczuk]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/literature/2018/summary/|title=The Nobel Prize in Literature 2018|website=NobelPrize.org|language=en-US|access-date=2019-01-07}} | Literature | “for a narrative imagination that with encyclopedic passion represents the crossing of boundaries as a form of life” |- |} == See also == * [[List of Nobel laureates]] * [[List of Nobel laureates by country]] == References ==
